page.title: 16SCHOOL FOR MALADJUSTED BOYS
page.content: Dromenagh house was built in 1910 for Sir Henry York and his wife Lady Lillian. The original house was burnt down and rebuilt in 1920. In 1948 the house was made into a school.There are now thirty-eight boys at the school and they go home to their parents every fortnight.There are four rooms called Windsor, Dover,Pembroke and Arundale, all named after castles. The boys range from six to eleven and if the teachers think they could do with another year they stay on until they are twelve.Some teachers live in the school and some in flats nearby. The school has an outdoor swimming pool and a plastic dome to go over the top so that the boys can go swimming in the winter as well as the summer. Dromenagh used to cover four hundred acres but now it only covers seventeen. By Kirsten Wigley
